title: Nightingale's Nest by Nikki Loftin
description:
A powerful novel about friendship and family that calls to mind *Bridge to Terabithia*.

Twelve-year-old John Fischer Jr., or Ã¢â‚¬Å“Little JohnÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ as heÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s always been known, is spending his summer helping his father with his tree removal business, clearing brush for Mr. King, the wealthy owner of a chain of Texas dollar stores, when he hears a beautiful song that transfixes him. He follows the melody and finds, not a bird, but a young girl sitting in the branches of a tall sycamore tree.

ThereÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s something magical about this girl, Gayle, especially her soaring singing voice, and Little JohnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s friendship with Gayle quickly becomes the one bright spot in his life, for his home is dominated by sorrow over his sisterÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s death and his parentsÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ ever-tightening financial difficulties.... And then Mr. King draws Little John into an impossible choice - forced to choose between his familyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s survival and a betrayal of Gayle that puts her future in jeopardy.

Inspired by a Hans Christian Andersen story, Nightingale's Nest is an unforgettable novel about a boy with the weight of the world on his shoulders and a girl with the gift of healing in her voice.

Genre: Children / Middle Grade | Fantasy
